reviewText: I'd dearly like to buy this, but it doesn't seem to be available on Amazon for region 1.  So... If you live in the Western Hemisphere of the planet Earth, don't waste your money, I guess?

An absolute delight to the eye, ear and mind - after 400 years the Immortal Bard birth and death was celebrated in style showcased in dance, song and speech, the performances imaginative and diverse and the hosts, Tennant and Tate were both a delight. The descriptive "star studded" is over-used but in this case accurate. One highlight I loved was a stage full of Hamlets arguing over how to deliver a line - one of the Hamlets being Prince Charles, himself. This is great for the home and would be even better for the classroom.

If you like Shakespeare, you're likely to enjoy this performance that commemorates the 400th anniversary of his death in 1616. Scenes from some of the plays, ballet, and Henry Goodman singing "Brush Up Your Shakespeare," which alone is worth the price.
I can't play it on my American TV!
The incredible talent and diversity of this production makes for an absolutely delightful viewing experience! A truly fitting tribute to the Man!
